ReviewList.Text: OMG Vaughn Heppner just keeps doing it!  Is there nothing this guy writes that isn't awesome?  This is the 3rd book in the Fenris series and it rocks just as hard as the 1st two!  The Kresh are finding out that some humans just can't be tamed.  The Cyborg War hasn't eradicated all the cyborgs, and if that isn't bad enough, there are the insect alien race of the Chirrs to contend with.  Now comes another psionic alien to throw a monkey wrench into the works (or does it just add more excitement?  Depends on what you're idea of excitement is).  For Cyrus Gant, this is the kind of excitement he definitely could do without.

The book starts by throwing you a curve;i did not see coming the death of an important character..the pace if really fast, the action is superb and we get to see old enemies coming into play as well as new allies.. the book ends in a way that you just want to read the next installment..highly recommended..

A good book! It starts bringing all the different  stories together, but it is very cluttered trying to get it all done! It is obvious the author was scrambling to get everything tied up by the end of the book. All in all it was a great story.I was very sorry to see it come to an end!

Good character play,  alternating persons not disruptive, story flows well, this final book had good closure but left an opening for a possible sequel. Have enjoyed every book I have read from Vaughn Heppner.
While there were some places in this book that I seemed to bog down, overall the book was a good read.  The Fennris series is a good continuation of the Doom Star series.  This was a good read.
Kind of a weird book for this author. Lots of page skipping and what seemed like a hurried ending considering the rest of the series (and precursor series). A bit disappointing
The book was a different approach from the other series. The mental powers the trip though Cryus Gants mind an interesting trip
Help her again brings forth a wonderful galactic romp.  Lots of lasers,space ships,creatures and more.  I want book four now.
Heppner provided a satisfying story in this trilogy.  Worth your time if you like SciFi with anthropological slant.
This is a good completion of the series and the the other series that this author has written.  I liked it a lot.
The mix of great creativity and good execution in this third book makes it very entertaining, I hope more come!
Not my favorite series by Mr. Heppner. It was okay to fill in the gaps between releases of better stories.
Liked it very much, hope for book 4.

Sadly, to me, the author spend way too much of the book on Cyrus inter mind struggles, adding many chapters but no new story, then he develops a sex loving cyborg which was just a wrong turn to me. Many more pages lost to use less to the point of the story nudity narration. I've read many of his books this was by far a real disappointment.

Mr. Heppner scores again with a slam bang story line that has a few surprises in it. A major character is killed off or is he?  I don't know if Vaughn is going to continue this series but I would sure like to see it happen.
